newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Mandela to meet East Timor's exiled Nobel winner.
newsitem.headline: Mandela to meet East Timor's exiled Nobel winner.

text.p: South African President Nelson Mandela will meet East Timorese exile and joint Nobel Peace Prize winner Jose Ramos Horta on Friday, officials said.
"They are meeting but the venue and the time have not yet been finalised," Mandela's spokesman Parks Mankahlana told Reuters on Thursday.
No press conference was scheduled after the meeting.
Asked about any links to Mandela's secret and highly unusual meeting last week with jailed Timorese rebel leader Xanana Gusmao while on a state visit to Indonesia, Mankahlana said:
"It (the meeting on Friday) is not a new initiative." He declined to elaborate further.

Mandela saw Gusmao, Indonesia's best-known political prisoner who is serving a 20-year term for resisting Indonesia's annexation of East Timor, after Indonesian President Suharto gave rare permission for a meeting.
Indonesia invaded East Timor in late 1975, annexing the former Portuguese colony the following year in an act that has not been recognised by the United Nations.
The United Nations regards Lisbon as the ruling power despite Jakarta having declared East Timor its 27th province.
A small band of armed guerrillas, led by Gusmao until his capture in 1992, and an overseas diplomatic effort led by Horta have opposed Jakarta's rule of the troubled territory.
